basics.name: Reza Arabpour
basics.label: Faculty Affiliate Researcher
basics.summary: MSc candidate in Computational Science & Engineering at McMaster University with expertise in geometric deep learning and computational finance. Faculty Affiliate Researcher at Vector Institute focusing on Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning and hypernetworks for stochastic processes.

work.name: Vector Institute for Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Advancing research in geometric deep learning and foundation models. Developing parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods for large language models.

work.name: McMaster University
work.summary: Working on improving novel deep learning architectures like hypernetworks. Optimizing foundation models (fine-tuning) for computational efficiency and effectiveness. Utilizing mathematical properties of underlying models and data functions.

work.name: McMaster University
work.summary: Teaching Assistant for graduate and undergraduate courses in Mathematics and DeGroot Business School. Courses include MFM 714 (Topics in Risk Management), MFM 713 (Computational Finance II), MFin 704 (Numerical Methods in Finance), Math 1MP3 (Introduction to Mathematical Scientific Computation).

work.name: Failed Startup
work.summary: Founded a startup with five professionals researching statistical arbitrage in FX and gold markets. Created multiple strategy baskets using genetic algorithms and fuzzy logic. Applied 24 well-rounded trading agents with proprietary framework across different time frames. Performed Monte-Carlo simulations measuring performance in Drawdown, VaR, Sharpe ratio metrics.

work.name: University of Tehran
work.summary: Teaching Assistant for various computer science and mathematics courses including Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms, Introduction to Graph Theory, Advanced Programming using C++, Fundamentals of Programming in Python for Mathematics/Statistics and Physics departments.

work.name: Omid Group
work.summary: Completed 100+ hours of training on financial market structures in Tehran Stock Exchange. Workshops on financial markets, global economy, and asset management industry. Proposed business creation ideas judged as final projects (2nd place among 30 participants).

work.name: Rahnema College
work.summary: Seven-week internship program developing 'Akaskhoone' project - an image-based social media app combining Instagram and Pinterest features. Used Python and Django Framework for mobile devices. Responsible for users' profile section and automated Python tests.
